category.title: Dispute Outcome
category.description: Describes the outcome of a dispute (one dispute can have several outcomes, e.g., violence and concessions

category.title: Arrests
category.description: Workers arrested

category.title: Violence by Police or Thugs
category.description: Workers' activism is met by violence from either police or company-hired thugs

category.title: Intervention by Officials
category.description: Officials (from the labor bureau, etc.) intervene in the dispute, gathering information and / or organizing negotiations

category.title: Formal Collective Bargaining
category.description: A formal CB negotiation is held with the participation of the official trade union

category.title: Informal Bargaining
category.description: Workers bargain with employers informally, i.e. there is not indication in the reports of the union being involved or of a new contract, etc.

category.title: Change of Policy (Pro-Worker)
category.description: A local government policy is changed in favor of the workers

category.title: No Change
category.description: The company or local government continues with its original policies, apparently undisturbed by the workers' activism

category.title: Payment
category.description: As a result of the strike or protest, the enterprise pays some or all of the raise / arrears / compensation demanded by the workers

category.title: Enterprise Ownership Type
category.description: This category categorizes strikes or protests by the types of enterprises (e.g. state-owned or private) against which they are organized

category.title: SOEs and Collectives
category.description: Strikes or protests occuring in state-owned or collective enterprises

category.title: Domestic Private
category.description: Strikes or protests occurring in Mainland Chinese-owned private enterprises

category.title: Foreign or Joint-Venture Private
category.description: Strikes or protests occurring in enterprises owned by foreign companies (or Taiwan or Hong Kong companies)

category.title: Self-Employed
category.description: Strikes or protests involving self-employed workers

category.title: Grievances and Demands
category.description: This category groups strikes and protests by the demands and grievances that gave rise to them

category.title: Food
category.description: Demands for greater availability of or quality of food

category.title: Higher Wages
category.description: "Offensive" (as opposed to defensive) demands for higher wages (not just enforcement of legal minimums or legal overtime payments)

category.title: Wage Arrears / Downward Wage Adjustments / Raised Rental Fees
category.description: "Defensive" (as opposed to offensive) demands for payment of wage arrears, including unpaid overtime and unpaid legal miminums, or demands to undo dow

category.title: Injuries / Illnesses / Deaths
category.description: Demands for compensation for work-related injuries or illnesses--or demands for safer working conditions

category.title: Ceramics
category.description: Strikes and protests by workers in the ceramics sector

category.title: Union Representation
category.description: Demands for the establishment of a union in a particular sector or enterprise or demands for a more representative union in the same

category.title: Competition
category.description: Demands for crackdown on competition, e.g. demands by legitimate cab drivers for a crackdown on illegal "black cabs"

category.title: Fuel and Other Prices
category.description: Demands for lower prices, such as fuel prices

category.title: Enterprise Privatization / Takeovers / Restructuring
category.description: Demands for a halt to the privatization or corporate takeover of a firm

category.title: Police / Fines
category.description: Demands for an end to police harassment or police violence

category.title: Layoffs / Transfers
category.description: Demands relating to layoffs or transfers of enterprise personnel

category.title: Benefits / Social Insurance / Bonuses
category.description: Demands for payment of benefits, including (but not exclusively) legally mandated social insurance

category.title: Hours / Speed-ups
category.description: Demands relating too many or too few work hours, speed-ups and "efficiency" programs

category.title: Abuse / HR Practices / Disrespect
category.description: Demands relating to ending physical or verbal abuse by employers

category.title: Corruption
category.description: Strikes or protests sparked by allegations of managerial corruption

category.title: Job Classification / Promotions
category.description: Strikes and protests over job classifications, job assignments and promotion systems

category.title: Loss of Self-Employed Status /  Loss of Vehicles
category.description: Strikes or protests relating to company takeovers of formerly privately operated cabs or buses (such a takeover can happen via an SOE) or plans to force drivers to buy new vehicles or lose their old ones on terms deemed unfair by drivers.

category.title: Industry Affected
category.description: This category divides strikes and protests by industry, e.g. electronics factories, taxis, etc.

category.title: Airlines
category.description: Strikes involving pilots, airplane mechanics and airport employees of all sorts

category.title: Apparel and Textile Factories
category.description: Strikes that have occurred at shoe or apparel factories

category.title: Auto and Auto Parts Factories
category.description: Strikes that have occurred in auto factories or auto parts factories

category.title: Banks
category.description: Workers at banks or targeting banks

category.title: Battery Factories
category.description: Strikes and protests related to battery factories

category.title: Beauty Parlors, Spas
category.description: Strikes and protests involving workers in beauty parlors, spas, nail salons, etc.

category.title: Bus and Truck Drivers
category.description: Strikes involving bus drivers or truck drivers

category.title: Ceramics and Glass
category.description: Strikes and protests occurring in ceramics factories

category.title: Chemicals, Fertilizers and Cement
category.description: Strikes relating to chemical or fertilizer factories

category.title: Construction Sites
category.description: Strikes at construction sites

category.title: Electronics Factories
category.description: Strikes that have occurred in electronics factories

category.title: Food and Beverage Factories
category.description: Strikes involving workers at food and beverage factories

category.title: Furniture Factories
category.description: Factories making furniture

category.title: Hospitals
category.description: Strikes involving workers at hospitals

category.title: Hotels and Restaurants
category.description: Strikes that have occurred in hotels, restaurants and other such service establishments

category.title: Janitors and Cleaners
category.description: Strikes involving janitors and cleaners--but not at the other institutions (hospitals, hotels, etc.)  of other categories

category.title: Machinery and Appliance Factories
category.description: Strikes that have occured in machinery factories

category.title: Mines
category.description: Strikes--or protests--at mines

category.title: Military Factories
category.description: Strikes and protests by workers from factories producing military goods

category.title: Office Workers: Accountants, Designers, etc.
category.description: Strikes and protests involving white collar workers not belonging to other categories.

category.title: Oil
category.description: Strikes and protests occurring in oil fields and oil refineries, etc.

category.title: Paper
category.description: Strikes or protests occuring in the paper manufacturing or  paper goods sectors

category.title: Pharmaceutical
category.description: Strikes and protests taking place in pharmaceutical plants and institutions developing drugs (not retailers)

category.title: Plastics
category.description: Strikes or protests relating to plastic forming factories

category.title: Police
category.description: Strikes by police officers or other public security personnel

category.title: Print Shops
category.description: Strikes or protests occurring in printing shops

category.title: Retailers
category.description: Strikes that occur at all kinds of retailers---big box stores, car dealserships, supermarkets, small shops, etc.

category.title: Sex Workers
category.description: Workers in the sex industry

category.title: Shipbuilding
category.description: Workers involved in shipbuilding

category.title: Steel Mills
category.description: Strikes at steel plants

category.title: Taxis
category.description: Strikes involving taxi drivers

category.title: Teachers
category.description: Strikes of school teachers

category.title: Telecommunications
category.description: Strikes involving telecom workers

category.title: Tourism
category.description: Strikes and protests in the tourism sector

category.title: Toy and Gift Factories
category.description: Strikes that have occurred in toy factories

category.title: Trains
category.description: Strikes in railway stations or trains themselves or by train maintenance or other related workers

category.title: Utilities and River Management
category.description: Strikes and protests taking place in enterprises relating to the provision of hydropower, gas, etc.

category.title: NONE
category.description: Holds uncategorized reports

category.title: Number of Workers Involved
category.description: This category divides strikes and protests by the number of workers involved

category.title: Dozens of Workers
category.description: Strikes or protests involving dozens of workers

category.title: Hundreds of Workers
category.description: Strikes or protests involving hundreds of workers

category.title: Thousands of Workers
category.description: Strikes or protests involving thousands of workers

category.title: Tens of Thousands of Workers
category.description: Strikes or protests involving tens of thousands of workers

category.title: Trusted Reports
category.description: Reports from trusted reporters
